subject: [OT] coverage plugins for eclipse?
msgSnippet: Apologies if this is OT, but IMHO coverage measurement (for guiding one s test writing) and IDEs (for writing and running one s tests) are both at least
messageBody:
Apologies if this is OT, but IMHO coverage measurement (for guiding
one's test writing) and IDEs (for writing and running one's tests) are
both at least tangentially related to JUnit ... and I don't know of a
good list for coverage measurement :-(

I'm wondering, what are folks who use Eclipse (or Eclipse-based
products) using to do coverage measurement and reporting? One option
is to just run the coverage tool from the command line or ant, but I'd
really like something more integrated, e.g.

0 a run config that would Run>{JUnit, JUnit Plug-in Test} under the
coverage tool and display results in a view

1 mark un/covered sources in Outline view or editors

The coverage plugins of which I'm aware are

* Clover

* jcoverage

* Rational Developer (Unfortunately its coverage tools are part of its
performance-testing tools, which complicates installation and use
for "normal" testing.)

Are there others?
